title: How to Build Your Self Confidence

steps.title: Try to catch yourself when you think bad things about yourself.
steps.content: Try to catch yourself when you think bad things about yourself. If you notice a negative thought, question it to see if it’s actually true. When you start to question your negative self-talk, you can adjust your thinking over time. [1] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source For example, if you think something like, “My friends probably don’t like me,” try asking yourself, “Is that true? Didn’t my friend just invite me to hang out last week?” Or, if you think something like, “I’ll never pass this test,” ask yourself, “How do you know? Can you tell the future?”

steps.title: Repeat phrases every day until you start to believe them.
steps.content: Repeat phrases every day until you start to believe them. Take a few moments before you go to work or school to look at yourself in the mirror and remind yourself of your positive characteristics. You can either say something that you believe about yourself or something that you would like to believe about yourself. Try saying things like: [2] X Expert Source Guy Reichard Life Coach Expert Interview. 19 March 2020. “I am an intelligent person.” “I am a good father.” “I have accomplished many important things in my life.” “People enjoy spending time with me.”

steps.title: Try to remember that you’re only human.
steps.content: Try to remember that you’re only human. Everyone makes mistakes, and you’re no different! Try to forgive yourself for things you did in the past so you can move on. Don’t hold yourself to a higher standard than everyone else. [3] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source If you’re having trouble forgiving yourself for something, try asking if you’d forgive a friend for the same mistake. Then, use that forgiveness on yourself.

steps.title: You might still have a lot to learn, but remind yourself that you're trying!
steps.content: You might still have a lot to learn, but remind yourself that you're trying! Being confident doesn’t mean overestimating your own abilities; instead, try to recognize where you might be slightly lacking, then work to improve that area. [4] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Business Review Online and print journal covering topics related to business management practices Go to source For example, if you just started a new job, you probably don’t know everything about the company yet. Spend some time learning from your coworkers to do the best job that you can do.

steps.title: It might seem silly, but sit down and write out a list.
steps.content: It might seem silly, but sit down and write out a list. [5] X Expert Source Guy Reichard Life Coach Expert Interview. 19 March 2020. Start with 5 things that you like about yourself and try to add something to the list every day. If you can’t think of anything, try asking your loved ones what they like about you to get you started. [6] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source For example, you could write, “I’m kind, I’m loving, I’m passionate about art, I’m creative, and I’m a good friend.” However, this confidence-boosting method doesn’t work for everyone. Some people struggle to take these statements seriously or feel embarrassed by them. Reader Poll: We asked 338 wikiHow readers, and only 11% prefer to reaffirm their self-worth by reflecting on their positive qualities and accomplishments . [Take Poll]

steps.title: You don’t have to explain yourself to anyone.
steps.content: You don’t have to explain yourself to anyone. If you’re feeling overwhelmed and don’t want to take on another responsibility, say “no.” It will be tough at first, but once you practice it, it will become second nature. [7] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source Saying “no” can often feel like we’re disappointing friends or family members. However, overwhelming yourself with responsibilities will only make you feel worse, and it can lead to lower self-esteem.

steps.title: If you’re really struggling with your confidence, a professional can help.
steps.content: If you’re really struggling with your confidence, a professional can help. They’ll be able to find the root of your low confidence so you can challenge your thoughts and break any negative thought patterns. A mental health professional can also help you work toward other goals, like improving your relationships or making changes in your life. [8] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Medical School Harvard Medical School's Educational Site for the Public Go to source If you’re a college student, check out the mental health resources on campus. You might be able to see a mental health professional for free.

steps.title: Negative people tend to lower your confidence.
steps.content: Negative people tend to lower your confidence. Instead, spend time with friends and family members who inspire you and push you to be your best self. You’ll know someone is good to be around if you feel excited and happy to hang out with them. [9] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source People who lower your confidence might make disparaging remarks about you or tell you that your goals are dumb. It probably feels draining to hang out with them, and you might be subconsciously avoiding them. If you want to make a new group of friends, try joining a club to meet people interested in a hobby of yours.

steps.title: Do something outside of your own comfort zone.
steps.content: Do something outside of your own comfort zone. If you’ve never tried playing chess before, play a few online games to get the hang of it. If you aren’t the best cook, try making a dish you’ve never had. There are many ways to acquire a new skill . Build your confidence in smaller areas to improve your overall self-esteem. [10] X Research source Try to expand your comfort zone slowly and steadily over time.

steps.title: Try to get 30 minutes of moderate exercise per day.
steps.content: Try to get 30 minutes of moderate exercise per day. Working a little exercise into your daily routine can do wonders for your mental health. Not only will it make you feel stronger and healthier, exercising releases chemicals in your brain that make you feel happier. It will boost your overall mood and it can break up your day if you're feeling stuck. [11] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Exercising doesn’t have to mean going to a gym and getting your pump on. You could swim, jog, do yoga, jump rope, or do an at-home workout routine.

steps.title: Make yourself happy by doing something fun.
steps.content: Make yourself happy by doing something fun. It could be a craft, an art piece, a nature walk, a hike, a jog, or even reading a good book. Spend 15 minutes doing something that you like to boost your mood and improve your overall self-esteem. [12] X Research source Try taking a break from technology while you do this, too. It can be nice to step away from the screens for a while.

steps.title: Body language is a huge indicator of confidence.
steps.content: Body language is a huge indicator of confidence. When you interact with others, be sure to keep your head and chin up, stand up straight, and look people in the eyes when you talk to them. Keep your hands out of your pockets and plant your feet in a wide stance. [13] X Research source If you’re listening to someone else talk, practice active listening skills by nodding your head and making eye contact.

steps.title: When you look good, you feel good, too.
steps.content: When you look good, you feel good, too. Try to shower every day, brush your hair, clean your teeth, and put on clean clothes. If you like makeup or jewelry, wear that too! Try to present yourself in a way that makes you feel confident. [14] X Research source If you’re itching for a new wardrobe but don’t want to break the bank, try hitting up a thrift store in your area.
